intro: Schmaltzia trilobata var. simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leaved schmaltzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple and lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
